_toypack_0.c2: This file is pretty big. It is the amalgamation of MANY of my own tweaks and some additional
_toypack_0.c3: tweaks from other packs. Ideally, everything is split into somewhat-organised sections.
_toypack_0.c4: You'll notice comments aren't just standalone strings. The resource loader DOES NOT like that.
_toypack_0.c5: Use a containing JSON object instead (like this one!) Good luck :)

_toypack_comment: A known issue is that, if there is an applicable biome ambiance to play, it will
—regardless of if you're in Creative mode. (i.e. music.game plays basically always)
There's not much I can do about this, but the Creative mode music _is_ here if you're lucky
Think of this as the equivalent of Overworld Survival mode being music.game, where this is
the Nether equivalent (technically for all gamemodes).

_toypack_2.c: Biome-based BGM: Replace with above definition of Survival mode (music.game) music

_toypack_5.c: Use damage/hit.ogg once instead of having to package in 3 copies:

_toypack_6.c: Define the old splash sound, and remove player swimming sounds: Non-player swim sounds are untouched

entity.skeleton_horse.swim.subtitle: subtitles.entity.skeleton_horse.swim
entity.skeleton_horse.swim._toypack_comment: Vanilla tones down the volume for this but I don't care

_toypack_28.c0: Remove some ambient sounds: The `intentionally_empty` event generates a log warning, so

_toypack_30.c: Stonecutter has a unique UI click sound unlike everything else. Opportunity for more legacy console I say!

_toypack_31.c2: Grass and Gravel, which are old, but also quieter. Here I just replace instances of

_toypack_33.c0: Full credit to Narotiza's "Consistent Sounds" resource pack for older Minecraft versions.
_toypack_33.c1: The below mostly their sounds.json work, linted and minorly tweaked by me. Additionally, I
_toypack_33.c2: will use their pack as basis for this section, as in the future I'll be adding consistent
_toypack_33.c3: sounds myself—given the original pack is no longer updated
